channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19 alert level 3 questions answered: The nitty gritty
item.description: Yesterday we covered off the beginner's guide to level 3, including advice for the lovelorn, today we dive into some more detailed questions from you, our beloved audience.

item.title: Dr Ashley Bloomfield takes public questions in live Q+A
item.description: Dr Ashley Bloomfield is holding a live Q+A on Facebook to talk about health and education. He is joined by Education Secretary Iona Holsted.

item.title: Covid-19: Live updates from New Zealand and around the world on 21 April
item.description: Live updates - General practitioners say they have been denied millions of dollars of Covid-19 funding promised by the government. See the latest on Covid-19 here.

item.title: Covid-19: Government PPE management to be reviewed by Auditor-General
item.description: The Auditor-General will provide an independent review of the management of personal protective equipment, or PPE.

item.title: Covid-19 latest update: Five new cases, one new death
item.description: A woman in her 70s has died from Covid-19 in Auckland and there are five new cases in the country, Director-General of Health Dr Ashley Bloomfield says.

item.title: Sex assault-acquitted police officer's actions fell short of standards - IPCA
item.description: While there is insufficient evidence to prove either of two sexual assaults a senior Northland police officer is accused of, some of his actions fell short of police standards, the IPCA says.

item.title: New Zealander in Peru reportedly dies from Covid-19
item.description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade has confirmed a New Zealander travelling abroad has died in Peru.

item.title: David Tamihere's murder convictions referred back to Court of Appeal
item.description: David Tamihere was convicted in 1990 of the murder of two Swedish tourists.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Digital solution' still missing in contact tracing efforts - expert
item.description: A University of Otago epidemiologist says increases in cases within clusters would suggest a failure on the part of the contact tracing system.

item.title: Police seek sightings of missing Auckland teen
item.description: Police are appealing for sightings of a 17-year-old boy who went missing in Auckland's Ōtāhuhu yesterday morning.

item.title: Woman charged with assault for spitting at train staff
item.description: A 32-year-old woman has been charged with assault after allegedly spitting at Auckland Transport staff.

item.title: ECE services wary of level 3 reopening
item.description: Early childhood services want more evidence it will be safe to reopen next week and some are likely to remain closed.

item.title: NZ cannot afford to wait for Covid-19 vaccine, scientists say
item.description: Some of the country's top scientists are calling on the government to urgently invest millions into research and development of Covid-19 vaccines.

item.title: Doctors and nurses relieved at govt's cautious approach
item.description: Intensive care specialist Andrew Stapleton spent much of last month preparing for the worst case scenario - hospitals overwhelmed by critically ill patients.

item.title: Police station fire: Man charged with arson
item.description: A man has been arrested following two suspicious fires in Mount Maunganui - one in a building housing the police station as well as other businesses.

item.title: Covid-19 lockdown extension: How New Zealand industries, politicians and public reacted
item.description: New Zealanders largely welcomed the government's decision to move to level 3 next week, but there has been some criticism of extending level 4 until then.

item.title: Covid-19 alert level 3: What you need to know
item.description: The national alert level 4 response to the Covid-19 coronavirus began at 11.59pm Wednesday, 25 March and is due to end at 11.59pm on Monday, 27 April.

item.title: Drone footage reveals lockdown from above
item.description: Watch: Drone footage taken in Auckland and Wellington shows few vehicles and an absence of pedestrians during the level 4 lockdown.
